text: The Press Democrat is a daily newspaper published in Santa Rosa, California. It has the largest circulation in California's North Bay. == History == The newspaper was started in 1897 by Ernest L. Finley. He combined Evening Press and Thomas Thompson's Sonoma Democrat (originally created as a voice for the Democratic Party). Finley also bought the Santa Rosa Republican in 1927 and brought it together with the Press Democrat in 1948. ==References== Category:Newspapers in California Category:1897 establishments in the United States
title: The Press Democrat
